title: .bmap suffix
content:
When generating MAC PS1 fonts with FOG, the suffix .bmap is added after the name of the font.   
Is there harm in removing this?   
I've done a number of tests and haven't found any problems.   
Does anyone know why this is added?   
Many typefaces from professional foundries do not   
feature this suffix but I suspect it may be a   
result of using Fontlab or RobFog for final font generation.   
   
Best,   
Eric
author: anonymous

comments.content: theres no reason not to remove it that i know of. ive had no problems.
